xxl.core.io.fat

Class FATDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.fat.FATDevice

  • public class FATDevice
extends Object
    This class represents a device like a floppy, partition, disk or something else. Each device has a BPB (BIOS Parameter Block), a FAT (FileAllocation Table), this may be FAT12, FAT16, or Fat32, a directory, and if it's a FAT32 a FSI (File System Info) as well as a Backup Boot Sector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FATDevice

        public FATDevice(String deviceName,
                 RawAccess rawAccess,
                 PrintStream out,
                 File dummyFile)
          throws InitializationException
        Create an instance of this object. This constructor will mount the device.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - is the name of the file.
        rawAccess - is the file which supports all IO-Operations to the (real) raw device.
        out - Output stream for some messages of the FATDevice. You can use System.out for example.
        dummyFile - The extension of a RandomAccessFile needs a file that exists inside the OS-file system. The file is never used, just opened read only and immediately closed again. This parameter only exists because of the inflexible implementation of RandomAccessFile.
        Throws:
        InitializationException - in case this object couldn't be initialized.

      • FATDevice

        public FATDevice(String deviceName,
                 byte fatType,
                 RawAccess rawAccess,
                 PrintStream out,
                 File dummyFile)
          throws WrongLength,
                 InitializationException
        Create an instance of this object. This constructor will format the device with the given fat type. For a FAT12 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 4084 512-byte-blocks. For a FAT16 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 4194304 512-byte-blocks and bigger than 32680 512-byte-blocks.. For a FAT32 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 0xFFFFFFFF bytes and bigger than 532480 512-byte-blocks.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - is the name of the file.
        fatType - the type of the fat.
        rawAccess - is the file which supports all IO-Operations to the (real) raw device.
        out - Output stream for some messages of the FATDevice. You can use System.out for example.
        dummyFile - The extension of a RandomAccessFile needs a file that exists inside the OS-file system. The file is never used, just opened read only and immediately closed again. This parameter only exists because of the inflexible implementation of RandomAccessFile.
        Throws:
        WrongLength - if the number of blocks of rawAccess are to big for the given fatType.
        InitializationException - in case this object couldn't be initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • fastFormat

        public void fastFormat()
        This operation will reinitialize the FAT and the root directory. The FAT will be cleared, only the entries that are marked as bad entries will remain. The root directory will be cleared, the only remaining entry is the entry for the root directory. Notice that this operation can only be performed to a existing device that was formatted in the past.

      • getDeviceName

        public String getDeviceName()
        Return the name of the device. Normally this method is used to handle the device name with the raw access. See also getRealDeviceName() for further information.
        Returns:
        name of the device.

      • getRealDeviceName

        public String getRealDeviceName()
        Return the real name of the device. In contrast to getDeviceName() this method returns the place and the name of the file. If you create a RAF-device you have the opportunity to store the raf-file on an other (real) device. For example: Your working directory is 'c:\xxl' you create a RAF-device with name 'fat12' on disk 'd:' in subfolder 'dir' then the real device name is 'g:\dir\fat12' but the device name that should be used operate on this file system implementation is 'fat12' only. This device name is returned by the method getDeviceName(). If you want to get or create a device you have to use this method because devices are unique by the (real) device name. For all other operations you should use the getDeviceName() method since for the file system implementation it doesn't matter where the file which simulates the file system is stored.
        Returns:
        the real name of the device.

                          long sectorNumber)

        sectorNumber - the number where the sector should be written.

      • readCluster

        public byte[] readCluster(long clusterNumber)
        Return the cluster given by clusterNumber as a byte array. The clusterNumber is the direct cluster number there is no indirection with method getFirstSectorNumberOfCluster(clusterNumber). The method reads bpb.SecPerClus sectors to build the cluster, there for the clusterNumber should be the first sector number of the cluster given by getFirstSectorNumberOfCluster(clusterNumber).
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster that should be returned.
        Returns:
        the cluster as byte array.

      • writeCluster

        public void writeCluster(long clusterNumber,
                         byte[] clusterContent)
        Write a cluster to disk. The cluster is written at the given clusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster at which the given cluster should be written.
        clusterContent - the data to write.

        protected List extendFileSize(long numOfClusters,
                              long lastClusterNumber)
                       throws NotEnoughMemory
        Extends the size of a file. All new clusters that are allocated will be automatically stored in the fat started at lastClusterNumber.
        Parameters:

        lastClusterNumber - the last cluster number of the file.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • addFreeClusters

        Mark all cluster numbers stored at the freeClustersList as free.
        Parameters:
        freeClusterList - list of cluster numbers that should be marked as free.

      • addFreeClustersMarkFirstAsEOC

        public void addFreeClustersMarkFirstAsEOC(long startClusterNumber)
        Mark cluster numbers as free. The cluster number startClusterNumber will be set to EOC_MARK all next clusters belonging to the cluster chain will be marked as free until the EOC_MARK is reached.
        Parameters:
        startClusterNumber - the cluster number to start with.

      • addFreeClusters

        public void addFreeClusters(long startClusterNumber)
        Mark cluster numbers as free beginning with the given startClusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        startClusterNumber - the cluster number to start with.

      • getFreeClusters

        public List getFreeClusters(long numOfFreeClusters)
                     throws NotEnoughMemory
        Get a list of size numOfFreeClusters with free cluster numbers as entries.
        Parameters:
        numOfFreeClusters - the number of free clusters.
        Returns:
        list with free cluster numbers as entries. The list is empty, if there are not enough free clusters.
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemory - in case there is not enough memory to support this operation.

      • getFreeClusters

        public List getFreeClusters(long numOfFreeClusters,
                            long lastClusterNumber)
                     throws NotEnoughMemory
        Return a list with numOfFreeClusters free cluster numbers. All this numbers are automatically stored at the fat started by the given lastClusterNumber.
        Parameters:
        numOfFreeClusters - the number of free clusters.
        lastClusterNumber - clusterNumber of the last cluster.
        Returns:
        a list with numOfFreeClusters free cluster numbers.
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemory - in case there is not enough memory to support this operation.

      • list

        protected String[] list(String fileName)
        Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory denoted by this fileName. If this fileName does not denote a directory, then this method returns null. Otherwise an array of strings is returned, one for each file or directory in the directory. Names denoting the directory itself and the directory's parent directory are not included in the result. Each string is a file name rather than a complete path. There is no guarantee that the name strings in the resulting array will appear in any specific order; they are not, in particular, guaranteed to appear in alphabetical order.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        Returns:
        an array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory denoted by this pathname. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if this pathname does not denote a directory, or if an I/O error occurs.

      • makeDirectory

        protected boolean makeDirectory(String directoryName)
        Creates the directory named by this pathname.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - the name of the directory.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the directory was created; false otherwise.

      • renameTo

        protected boolean renameTo(String fileName,
                           String newName)
        Renames the file denoted by fileName to newName. If the entry named by fileName is an existing file, it will be deleted and a new file/directory given by newName will be created (with all subdirectories if they don't exist). It is not possible to change the device name. In case the destination file/directory already exists, the old file will not be deleted and the renaming operation will not processed. In case the entry named by this pathname is a directory the directory is only deleted if it is empty.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file which should be renamed.
        newName - the new name for the named file.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise.

      • listRoots

        protected String[] listRoots()
        Returns an array of strings naming the files in the root directory. There is no guarantee that the name strings in the resulting array will appear in any specific order; they are not, in particular, guaranteed to appear in alphabetical order.
        Returns:
        An array of strings naming the files and directories in the root directory. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if an I/O error occurs.

      • setLastWriteTime

        protected boolean setLastWriteTime(String fileName,
                                   long time)
        Sets the last-modified time of the file or directory named by fileName.
        Parameters:

        time - the new last-modified time, measured in milliseconds since the epoch (00:00:00 GMT, January 1, 1970).
        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation succeeded; false otherwise.

      • setLastWriteTime

        protected boolean setLastWriteTime(String fileName,
                                   long time,
                                   boolean writeThrough)
        Sets the last-modified time of the file or directory named by fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        time - the new last-modified time, measured in milliseconds since the epoch (00:00:00 GMT, January 1, 1970).
        writeThrough - indicates if this modification should be written to disk immediately or later. If the value is true the modification is written immediately.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation succeeded; false otherwise.

      • setLastWriteDate

        protected boolean setLastWriteDate(String fileName,
                                   int year,
                                   int month,
                                   int day)
        Set the last write date of the given fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        year - the year of the last write date, valid range from 1980 to 2107.
        month - the month of the last write date, valid range from 1 to 12.
        day - the day of the last write date, valid range from 1 to 31.
        Returns:
        true if the last date could be set; false otherwise.

      • setLastWriteDate

        protected boolean setLastWriteDate(String fileName,
                                   int year,
                                   int month,
                                   int day,
                                   boolean writeThrough)
        Set the last write date of the given fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        year - the year of the last write date, valid range from 1980 to 2107.
        month - the month of the last write date, valid range from 1 to 12.
        day - the day of the last write date, valid range from 1 to 31.
        writeThrough - indicates if this modification should be written to disk immediately or later. If the value is true the modification is written immediately.
        Returns:
        true if the last date could be set; false otherwise.

      • setLastAccessDate

        protected boolean setLastAccessDate(String fileName,
                                    int year,
                                    int month,
                                    int day)
        Set the last access date to the given fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        year - the last access year, valid range from 1980 to 2107.
        month - the last access month, valid range from 1 to 12.
        day - the last access day, valid range from 1 to 31.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation is successfully done; false otherwise.

      • setLastAccessDate

        protected boolean setLastAccessDate(String fileName,
                                    int year,
                                    int month,
                                    int day,
                                    boolean writeThrough)
        Set the last access date to the given directory entry.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        year - the last access year, valid range from 1980 to 2107.
        month - the last access month, valid range from 1 to 12.
        day - the last access day, valid range from 1 to 31.
        writeThrough - indicates if this modification should be written to disk immediately or later. If the value is true the modification is written immediately.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation is successfully done; false otherwise.

      • getNumRootDirSectors

        public long getNumRootDirSectors()
        Return the number of sectors of the root directory. The returned value is only valid for FAT12 or FAT16 FAT'S.
        Returns:
        the number of sectors of the root directory.

      • getFirstSectorNumberOfCluster

        public long getFirstSectorNumberOfCluster(long clusterNumber)
        Calculates the first sector number for the given cluster number. Important: variable firstDataSector must be initialized.
        Parameters:
        clusterNumber - the number of the cluster.
        Returns:
        the first sector number for the cluster with the given cluster number.

      • copyFileToRAW

        public void copyFileToRAW(File file,
                          String directoryName)
                   throws DirectoryException,
                          FileNotFoundException,
                          IOException,
                          InitializationException
        This method can be used to exchange the data of a file from the original file system to this file system based on raw-access. The directory path to the file directoryName must exist, otherwise this operation could not be done.
        Parameters:
        file - the source file.
        directoryName - the name of the destination file.
        Throws:
        DirectoryException - in case the copy process couldn't be done.
        FileNotFoundException - in case the file couldn't be found.
        IOException - in case an I/O error with file occurred.
        InitializationException - in case the ExtendedRandomAccessFile couldn't be initialized.

      • copyFileToOriginalFileSystem

        public void copyFileToOriginalFileSystem(String rawDirectoryName,
                                         File originalFile)
                                  throws DirectoryException,
                                         IOException,
                                         InitializationException
        This method can be used to exchange the data of a file from this file system based on raw-access to the original file system.
        Parameters:
        rawDirectoryName - the name of the source file.
        originalFile - the destination file.
        Throws:
        DirectoryException - in case the copy process couldn't be done.
        IOException - in case an I/O error with file occurred.
        InitializationException - in case the ExtendedRandomAccessFile couldn't be initialized.

      • getFile

        public ExtendedFile getFile(String pathname)
        Return an instance of ExtendedFile.
        Parameters:
        pathname - the given pathname.
        Returns:
        an instance of ExtendedFile with the given pathname.

      • getFile

        public ExtendedFile getFile(String parent,
                            String child)
        Return an instance of ExtendedFile.
        Parameters:
        parent - is the path to the parent directory.
        child - is the name of the file or directory.
        Returns:
        an instance of ExtendedFile with the given parent and child name merged to a pathname.

      • getRandomAccessFile

        public ExtendedRandomAccessFile getRandomAccessFile(String fileName,
                                                    String mode)
                                             throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                    DirectoryException
        The mode argument must either be equal to "r" or "rw", indicating that the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output, respectively. The write methods on this object will always throw an IOException if the file is opened with a mode of "r". If the mode is "rw" and the file does not exist, then an attempt is made to create it. An IOException is thrown if the name argument refers to a directory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        mode - indicates if the file is to be opened for input only or for both input and output
        Returns:
        an instance of ExtendedRandomAccessFile with the given fileName and mode, or null in case there is already an opened ExtendedRandomAccessFile with an other mode.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, or cannot be opened or created for any other reason.
        DirectoryException - in case the ExtendedRandomAccessFile couldn't be initialized.

      • close

        public void close(String fileName)
        Close the file with name fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.

      • writeByte

        public void writeByte(String fileName,
                      int value,
                      long filePointer,
                      long sectorNumber)
        Write the given value as a byte at the index calculated by filePointer and sectorNumber.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file.
        value - the data.
        filePointer - the current position in a file.
        sectorNumber - the current sector number the filePointer points in.

      • readByte

        public byte readByte(long filePointer,
                     long sectorNumber)
        Read a byte from the data region of a file given by filePointer and sectorNumber.
        Parameters:
        filePointer - the current position in a file.
        sectorNumber - the current sector number the filePointer points in.
        Returns:
        the read byte
